ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Developed historical analysis skills, and in depth understanding of the beginnings of human civilisation, as well as the effect of rapid climate change events on world history. Also developed understanding of paleoclimate proxies and archaeological techniques.
How civilization developed and the reasons why. Agriculture and climate systems were emphasized. Really cool course.

Academic discussion, arguments and preserverance had been key themes that I have picked up on other than the facts and discussion in the syllabus. I find the topics that expand over the syllabus and include students in a professors work very interesting

I learned valuable skills when it came to analyzing primary sources and critically formulating ideas based on the evidence we studied. I also gained insight on the importance of the environment in global history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: The teaching quality of Harvey Weiss and his well put together syllabus

Professor Weiss did a phenomenal job teaching this course and keeping the class engaged. Most of his teachings are a primary source stemming from his own experiences which makes the course really interesting.

Interesting and well designed to give a broad introduction to archeology

The last half of the course was a bit more pice-by-pice and harder to follow than the first half
The strength was the knowledge of Professor Weiss and his stories. The weakness was the lack of organization at points.
It was a great class. Very interesting

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, definitely to any student who has any interest in origins of human civilisation.
Yes. Most interesting class I've taken.
I would recommend this course to another student. Professor Weiss always comes to class with a smile and is an incredibly fun teacher to learn from.
Yes, I loved this class. It was very interesting.
